Journal Staff Writer
title: Classical concerts for weekend of Oct. 15 - Entertainment & Life
text: THURSDAY AHA Night Concerts: First Congregational Church, 282 Rock St., Fall River. (508) 674-6128; email judithconrad@mindspring.com. Pianist Judith Conrad performs works by Beethoven, Liszt, Prokofiev and Chopin, 5 p.m. The Delight Consort performs music for Renaissance wind instruments, 6 p.m. Free. FRIDAY-SATURDAY Rhode Island Philharmonic Orchestra: The Vets, One Avenue of the Arts, Providence. 248-7000; tickets.riphil.org . Beethoven's "Pastoral," works by Beethoven, Sibelius and and Prokofiev. Larry Rachleff directing and featuring violinist Benjamin Beilman . Amica Rush Hour Concert, Fri 6:30 pm ($37-$47). Concert, Sat 8 p.m ($15-$100). SATURDAY-SUNDAY Brown University Orchestra: Brown's Sayles Hall Auditorium, College Green, Water, Brown and George streets, Providence. 863-3234; brown.edu/academics/music/events . Works by Stravinsky, Liadov and Shostakovich. Paul Phillips conducting. Sat. 8 p.m.; Sun. 2 p.m. $15, 65+ $10, students/Brown ID $5. SUNDAY Bob Casola, trombone, and Cheryl Casola, piano: St. Peter's by-the-Sea, 72 Central St., Narragansett. 783-4623; stpetersbythesea.com . "Trombone Colors," featuring baroque, spirituals and jazz. 4 p.m. Free. Nonperishable donation or free-will offering benefits the church's community market. Chopin Club: Mary K. Hail Music Mansion, 88 Meeting St., Providence. Musicale featuring pianist Ann Sears; soprano Joanne Mouradjian with pianist Ann Sears; trio with pianist Philip Martorella, violinist Emily Anthony and cellist Elizabeth Reardon. Works by Bach, Ravel, Mozart and Debussy. 2 p.m. Free. Pianist I-Heung Lee: Redwood Library, Harrison Room, 50 Bellevue Ave., Newport. 847-0295, ext. 112. Works by Bach, Saint-Saens, Leschetizky, Mozart and Liszt. 3 p.m. $10, members $5. New Bedford Symphony Orchestra: Zeiterion Theatre, 684 Purchase St., New Bedford. (508) 994-2900; zeiterion.org; nbsymphony.org . Mendelssohn's "Elijah." Featuring soprano Noune Karapetian, mezzo-soprano Margaret Lias, tenor Matthew Anderson, baritone Philip Lima plus the Rhode Island College Chorus and singers from the Sippican Choral Society and the New Bedford Choral Society. 3 p.m. $25-$60; $10 tickets available for children/students 22 and younger. Ocean State Theatre Company: 1245 Jefferson Blvd., Warwick. 921-6800; oceanstatetheatre.org . "Celebrating the Songs of Rodgers & Hammerstein." Performers include Katie Clark, Joe DiPietro, Steve Gagliastro, Alyssa Gorgone, Wayne Hu, Brody Karn, Tommy Labanaris, Jonathan Olivera, Roger Reed, Helena Tafuri and Kristin Wetherington. 6 p.m. $39. Organist Hector Olivera: First Presbyterian Church of Newport, 6 Everett St., Broadway and Everett streets, Newport. 847-1749. 4 p.m. Free. Page 2 of 2 - Pianist Andrius Ziabys and Friends: Westport Point United Methodist Church, 1912 Main St., Westport Point. (508) 636-0698; concertsatthepoint.org . With violinist Andy Gandelsman. Works by Bach, Beethoven, Messiaen and Faure. 3 p.m. $25, students $10. Part of the Concerts on the Point Series.
